cab.content: SECRET Copy No. 6 8C(54) 202 CABINET OFFICE18th June, 1954 RE COR D CO PYCABINETINDO-CHINANote by the Secretary of State for Foreign affairs circulate for the information of my colleagues the following extract froma letter, dated 29th May, from Her Majesty's Minister at Saigon.A. E.Geneva,17th June, 1954.Extract" The mood of the country (Vietnam) is difficult to determine, but itwould not be far wrong to say that most Vietnamese whine to the followingtune: ' Somebody will have to do something for us. We can't be expectedto work out our own salvation.'A spineless people headed by a flabby octopus.Laos, on the other hand, is still showing up well. I hope we can do something to safeguard the interests of the best elements there."46358Printed for the Cabinet. June 1954
